intro: Haplophyllum villosulum, commonly known as the hairy leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Haplophyllum villosulum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
